newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA TO REDUCE CRUDE OIL STOCKPILE - MINISTER.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA TO REDUCE CRUDE OIL STOCKPILE - MINISTER.

text.p: The South African Cabinet on Wednesday decided to reduce the government's stockpile of crude oil to 36 million barrels from its current 48 million, Minerals and Energy Affairs Minister Penuell Maduna said.
He told a media briefing that the stockpile would be reduced to 36 million barrels or 90 days' supply to keep in line with international norms.

"We are reducing it essentially because there is no longer any threat to the security of our supplies two and a half years into our democracy and even more years since the lifting of sanctions, particularly the oil embargo," Maduna said.
"So we will now maintain the stock levels which are internationally approved."
The stockpile is kept in storage tanks at Saldanha Bay and in disused mines further inland.
